Finnish payroll handling (monthly pay run)

This workflow describes the bookkeeping core of running payroll in a small company: ensuring the chart of accounts, accounting entity, and periods are in place; maintaining the employee register; running payroll for a month with a chosen pay date; producing balanced posting intent for wages and withholdings; and feeding those postings into the journal and later into bank and reconciliation steps. The journey is expressed in BusDK datasets and bus payroll commands so that salary and tax entries stay traceable and double-entry consistent.

Prerequisites

Payroll depends on the same master data as the rest of the accounting workflow. The chart of accounts must include the accounts used for wage expense, withholding payables, and net pay (and, where applicable, employer-side costs). The accounting entity and accounting periods must be configured so that the payroll month and pay date fall within an open period. Alice ensures these are in place using bus accounts, bus entities, and bus period before setting up employees or running payroll.

Employee register

Alice initializes the payroll area if it does not yet exist, then registers each employee with the identifiers and pay structure that payroll will use:

bus payroll init
bus payroll employee add --employee-id <id> --entity <entity-id> --start-date <date> \
  --gross <amount> --withholding-rate <rate> \
  --wage-expense <account> --withholding-payable <account> --net-payable <account>

The employees master data stores employee identity, entity reference, start and optional end date, gross pay, withholding rate, and the three ledger accounts (wage expense, withholding payable, net payable). These accounts are used when generating posting lines so that each payroll run produces consistent, balanced entries. See Register an employee and Set employee pay structure for the exact fields and semantics.

Running payroll for a month

For each pay month, Alice runs payroll with a chosen pay date. The run computes wages and withholdings for all employees active in that month and writes a payroll run record plus the associated payment and posting data:

bus payroll run --month <YYYY-MM> --pay-date <YYYY-MM-DD> [--run-id <id>]

The run produces balanced posting intent: for each employee, debit wage expense and credit net payable and withholding payable (and, when supported, employer-cost accounts) so that the aggregate lines are double-entry consistent. Run payroll and List payroll runs describe the run record and how to list runs for review.

From posting intent to journal and bank

The posting output from bus payroll run (or from bus payroll export when using an existing run) is intended to be consumed by the journal. Alice (or a script) appends the posting lines to the workspace journal dataset using bus journal add or an equivalent append path so that payroll appears in the same ledger as invoices and other transactions. Once in the journal, payroll postings participate in trial balance and period close like any other entries. When net pay is later paid from the company bank account, that bank transaction is imported with bus bank import and can be matched or reconciled against the payroll-related journal entries using bus reconcile, keeping the link between pay run, ledger, and bank statement explicit.

Scope: what works today versus planned

Today the bus-payroll module implements validate and export. Integration tests in the module repository prove that validation succeeds for complete payroll datasets and that export produces deterministic CSV posting lines for a given run; global flags (including -C, -o, -q, -v, --color, --format) are covered by unit and integration tests. The current implementation expects payroll data under a payroll/ directory (employees, payruns, payments, and posting-account mapping). The full sequence — init, run, list, and employee add / employee list — is specified in the module CLI reference and in the bus-payroll SDD but is not yet implemented there; until that is in place, the end-to-end journey from empty workspace through employee register and monthly run to journal append is not covered by e2e tests. In practice you can today maintain payroll CSV and schema files (by hand or by another tool), run bus payroll validate to check consistency, and run bus payroll export <run-id> to obtain posting CSV for manual or scripted journal append.

Planned extensions include aligning the implemented CLI and data layout with the documented init/run/list/employee commands and workspace-root layout, deeper employer-cost handling, and integration with authority filing (e.g. tax and pension reporting). Those are out of scope for this workflow page; the Development status table summarizes current readiness per module for this journey.
